Read this sample answer to the writing task in the previous exercise and click on the mistakes. There are 10. To see the IELTS Writing Task 1 again, click on the icon on the right.
Writing Task 1

p.font: shows: Present simple is the correct tense here.
percentages: The vertical axis tells us that the figures are percentages.
is: No time period is referred to in the graph, simple present is the appropriate tense.
spend: No time period is referred to in the graph, simple present is the appropriate tense.
is: No time period is referred to in the graph, simple present is the appropriate tense.
three in five: The figure for girls is 58 per cent, which is almost three in five.
three-fifths: The figure for girls is 56 per cent, which is approximately three-fifths.
is: No time period is referred to in the graph, simple present is the appropriate tense.
a third: The figure for boys is 34 per cent, which is approximately a third.
seem: No time period is referred to in the graph, simple present is the appropriate tense.

section.p: Remember - there is no 'correct' answer for Writing Task 1. There are many possible approaches to the task and the sample answer given here is just one way the information shown in the chart can be described.
